questions.question: What is the purpose of the `<template>` element in HTML?
options: To define a reusable block of HTML that is not rendered until it is used by JavaScript.
To specify metadata for the document.
To create a table template.
To define a section of content for printing.
questions.answer: To define a reusable block of HTML that is not rendered until it is used by JavaScript.

questions.question: How do you create a custom element in HTML?
options: By using the `customElements.define` method in JavaScript.
By defining a new HTML tag.
By adding a `data-*` attribute.
By using the `<custom-element>` tag.
questions.answer: By using the `customElements.define` method in JavaScript.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the `data-*` attribute in HTML?
options: To store custom data private to the page or application.
To link to external stylesheets.
To define custom styles for an element.
To set element attributes dynamically.
questions.answer: To store custom data private to the page or application.

questions.question: What does the `rel='noopener'` attribute do when used with `target='_blank'`?
options: It prevents the new page from being able to access the originating page's `window` object.
It opens the link in a new tab without referrer information.
It disables JavaScript in the new window.
It ensures that the link is opened in a private browsing session.
questions.answer: It prevents the new page from being able to access the originating page's `window` object.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the `<slot>` element in Web Components?
options: To create a placeholder in a Web Component's shadow DOM for user-provided content.
To define external JavaScript sources.
To specify styles for shadow DOM.
To create a reusable component.
questions.answer: To create a placeholder in a Web Component's shadow DOM for user-provided content.

questions.question: What is the `shadow DOM`?
options: A separate DOM tree that is attached to an element but is hidden from the main document.
A method to control styles of an element.
A type of CSS selector.
A framework for building web applications.
questions.answer: A separate DOM tree that is attached to an element but is hidden from the main document.

questions.question: How can you define the language of the content in HTML5?
options: By using the `lang` attribute on the `<html>` tag.
By using the `<meta>` tag.
By using the `language` attribute on the `<body>` tag.
By setting the `lang` property in CSS.
questions.answer: By using the `lang` attribute on the `<html>` tag.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the `<picture>` element in HTML5?
options: To provide multiple sources for responsive images based on different device characteristics.
To create a slideshow of images.
To define a canvas for graphics.
To display images with captions.
questions.answer: To provide multiple sources for responsive images based on different device characteristics.

questions.question: What does the `inputmode` attribute do?
options: It specifies the type of virtual keyboard to display on mobile devices.
It defines the input format for a form element.
It sets the maximum length of input in a text field.
It provides a hint to the user about what type of data to enter.
questions.answer: It specifies the type of virtual keyboard to display on mobile devices.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the `FormData` object in HTML5?
options: To construct a set of key/value pairs representing form fields and their values.
To submit form data via AJAX requests.
To validate form inputs before submission.
To format the form data for display.
questions.answer: To construct a set of key/value pairs representing form fields and their values.
